item.title: Simplifying Middleware in Go
item.description: Simplifying Middleware in Go Cheat Sheet Handler type interface type Handler interface { ServeHTTP(ResponseWriter, *Request) } Handle() function func Handle(pattern string, handler Handler) HandleFunc() function func HandleFunc(pattern string, handler func(ResponseWriter, *Request)) HandlerFunc type type HandlerFunc func(ResponseWriter, *Request) ServeHTTP method func (f HandlerFunc) ServeHTTP(w ResponseWriter, r *Request) I want to discuss some of the discoveries, and challenges, I ran into while building a Golang http web server, and making the authentication part of the application.

item.title: Weekly Dev Update 2
item.description: Weekly Dev Update Arden Labs Golang in AI Webinar This week I had a chance encounter! I was listening to ‘Cup O’ Go’ podcast, where Bill Kennedy mentioned some of the trainings that Ardan Lab does, which led to me seeing the Ardan Labs was sponsoring a free Webinar on how to use Golang to create AI services! So many of my side projects related to AI were shelved because of how commited I am to learning Golang.

item.title: Weekly Dev Update
item.description: Weekly Dev Update Building a Web Server & Creating This Blog Building a Golang Web Server from the ground up I turned a basic empty Golang project, into my first attempt at building a web server. This has been much harder than I thought. There is so much about building a Golang web server that is significantly different from the API’s I built in Java in the MVC design pattern. On top of learning new Go concepts, learning a new folder structure, the terms that go along with this kind of project has been seriously jarring.
